intro: Echium italicum var. biebersteinii, commonly known as the Alpine evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
